As these institutions tout their efforts to diversify at every level, from the student body to the faculty & staff, I believe they are a perfect place to encourage greater inclusion and equal opportunity in the intractable asset management industry.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: 3) Authorize a conference, every five years, to convene institutions of higher education and investment advisors, firms, and consultants to develop professional networks and increase the visibility of business opportunities.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: 2) Require the Minority Business Development Agency to publish a biannual report recommending legislative changes and best practices for substantially increasing the use of women- and minority-owned firms in higher education investment and bond transactions.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
To increase transparency and foster greater accountability, my bill would:
1)Amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require colleges & universities to provide information about investments with women- & minority-owned firms to be included in other data annually collected.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: That’s why I introduced the Endowment Transparency Act to provide public transparency and accountability for diversity and inclusion in the management of endowment funds for federally-funded colleges and universities—which, again, account for more than $821B in assets.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: Although this was helpful in obtaining important data on the usage of diverse-owned firms and practices among some higher ed institutions, it's clear that more information is needed to track whether or not these taxpayer subsidized institutions are providing equal opportunity.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
While some institutions, such as the University of California, track and disclose investments with diverse-owned firms, others did not appear to have ever adopted policies or practices to address potential biases in the selection of managers.

Our report:
https://t.co/Pep7c5OSmH

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
There is nothing more tragic than a child who feels so alone & in pain they fall victim to suicide. It is incumbent upon Congress to take action to support our children in moments of crisis. 

That’s what the Cady Housh and Gemesha Thomas Student Suicide Prevention Act will do.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: The bipartisan Cady Housh and Gemesha Thomas Student Suicide Prevention Act will provide funding to train school staff and students in suicide prevention and intervention strategies—which is critical, considering 4 out of 5 kids who attempt suicide give clear warning signs.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
Cady Housh and Gemesha Thomas were beloved by their family & friends and vital members of their communities. Tragically, they fell victim to suicide before reaching adulthood. 

This bill is named in their honor to assist other children who are struggling with mental health.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
Suicide is the 2nd leading cause of death among Americans aged 10-24, and each day there are an average of more than 3,703 suicide attempts by kids grades 9-12.

That’s why I’m introducing the Cady Housh and Gemesha Thomas Student Suicide Prevention Act.
https://t.co/AKqPgXbSC7

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: The time has come for America to put additional resources into improving real estate valuation policies and practices. The Real Estate Valuation Fairness and Improvement Act is an important step in that effort.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: The Real Estate Valuation Fairness and Improvement Act would immediately convene a task force to evaluate and respond to racial disparities in real estate valuation, and would create a federal grant program to promote diversity and inclusion in the appraisal profession.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
One reason for these disparities is the lack of diversity within the appraisal industry. According to data from the Appraisal Institute, over 85% of the 78,000 appraisers in the U.S. is white and over 77% identify as male. That needs to change.
https://t.co/T2i8Gyt7JB

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
In fact, a report from the Brookings Institute found that homes in majority-Black neighborhoods are valued at roughly half the price as homes in neighborhoods with no Black residents. 
https://t.co/9j2thC5NGQ

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
It’s no secret that homeownership is critical to American families attempting to climb the economic ladder. Sadly, It’s also no secret that homes owned by people of color are too often devalued in comparison to homes owned by their white neighbors.
https://t.co/UqjqDxeFNG

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: .@FSCDems are putting forward numerous legislative solutions to bolster our nation’s public housing system and protect tenants. Looking forward to today’s hearing and working with my colleagues to increase investment in public and affordable housing during the 117th Congress!

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: At today’s hearing, lawmakers will discuss legislation from @RepMaxineWaters to protect public housing tenants, a bill from @RepAOC to repeal the Faircloth Amendment, & a proposal from @RepBowman and myself to expand access to broadband to millions of public housing tenants.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: As someone who grew up in public housing, I understand how important this lifeline can be for low-income families, seniors, and people with disabilities. However, due to underinvestment, our nation’s public housing system is in a state of crisis and disrepair.

These bills have nothing to do with taking guns away from responsible gun owners, which includes the vast majority of gun owners in America.
 
This is about taking common sense steps to protect our communities and keep weapons out of the hands of bad actors.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: Since 1998, the #CharlestonLoophole has put over 75,000 guns into the hands of prohibited gun owners. We can fix this loophole and prevent these weapons from falling into the wrong hands, which is why I was proud to support H.R. 1446. https://t.co/MeNHTeolKo

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
Congress must also take action to close the #CharlestonLoophole, which allows someone with a criminal background to buy a gun before their background check is completed.
 
This is what led to the murder of 9 innocent worshipers at Emanuel AME Church in Charleston, SC.

tweet_text:

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
Charlie “Bird” Parker’s famous Grafton saxophone was auctioned off in London back in 1994.
 
I was Mayor of Kansas City at the time, and the American Jazz Museum at 18th & Vine was still 3 years in the making.
 
But we knew Bird’s cream-colored alto sax belonged in his hometown. https://t.co/TEiPYWU6HO

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: It’s clear from those claiming credit and posing for pictures that these individuals truly believe they are above the law. It is imperative that we demonstrate they are not. Such lawlessness and a direct attack on our democracy cannot go unpunished.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: Each and every insurrectionist who participated in and incited the domestic terror attack on our nation’s Capitol Building, which led directly to the death of Officer Sicknick, needs to be held accountable and prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: And a major thank you to @SierraClub, @350, @World_Wildlife, @CeresNews, @CenterForBioDiv, @Earthguardianz, @MazaskaTalks, @GiniwCollective, @ciel_tweets, @ClimateHawkVote, @ThisIsZeroHour, and everyone who endorsed this important piece of legislation.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: Fighting #ClimateChange is not just the moral thing to do, but also the wise thing to do to secure the financial futures of hard-working Americans. Now, let’s get to work on getting the #RESPONDAct passed into law!

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: The data we’ve seen to date is clear: #ClimateChange poses a massive risk to our economy, & this bill will ensure the retirement benefits of millions of federal workers are protected from those risks.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: The more we examine how #ClimateChange impacts our financial system, the better we can protect the livelihoods of  our nation’s valuable workforce, while incentivizing corporations to quickly transition to renewable energy sources.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: Should these studies determine pensions would yield greater results if they implement low-carbon investment strategies, then the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board would immediately be directed to transition their investment practices accordingly.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: The #RESPONDAct would establish the necessary resources to analyze the adverse effects of #ClimateChange on the economy and require annual reports projecting and accounting for these costs, including how they impact the pensions of federal workers.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: As the world continues to transition away from fossil fuels to protect future generations, it’s important that federal retirees aren’t set up to fail with retirement portfolios heavily invested in the fossil fuel industry.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text: With the #RESPONDAct, @RepRashida and I are calling on financial regulators to examine the economic costs of #ClimateChange and utilize the data to make sound investments on behalf of more than 5.5 million federal employees.

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
I am proud to work with @RepRashida to introduce the #RESPONDAct, legislation that would protect federal pensions from the economic impacts of #ClimateChange.
https://t.co/8FA3co7p3q

As we reflect on the tragedy of #September11, let us honor the memory of those we lost by coming together as one nation to face another common enemy. Let us show the same resolve we displayed in those dark hours to defeat today’s foe. Let us stand united.
 
#NeverForget

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
We remember, on that day and the days that followed, we were no longer Democrats or Republicans, Missourians or Kansans.
 
We were all Americans. 

#NeverForget

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
But we also remember the courage and heroism on display from our first responders. We remember the nation coming together as one—united and resilient—in the face of evil. 

#NeverForget

name: Rep. Emanuel Cleaver
tweet_text:
On this solemn day we remember the 2,977 souls that were taken from us too soon. We remember the pain, agony and anger we all felt as the news broke. We remember the shock and horror as the images were relayed to us on the news. 

#NeverForget

As we reflect on this despicable tragedy, let us renew our fight to upend systemic injustice that has plagued our nation for too long.

We can start by passing the Emmett Till Antilynching Act

The USPS is a lifeline to millions of seniors, veterans, rural communities, & so many more. Messing with the #PostalService is messing with people’s lives. That’s why @HouseDemocrats passed legislation to undo these policies that delay service.
 
Now, the Senate must do the same. https://t.co/K3TK7Cz4ZE

I’ve heard from countless constituents who have struggled to get their Economic Impact Payment from the IRS.

The agency must do better.

That’s why I joined @RepJahanaHayes and over 125 of my colleagues calling for much-needed improvements. https://t.co/yCIxbejLH4
